Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can include a fish in their drawing, showing it as part of its natural environment.
The student can label the parts of the fish's habitat that are necessary for its survival, such as water and plants.
The student can show other living things that might be part of the fish's habitat, like plants or other animals.
The student can label the resources in the habitat that the fish needs to survive, such as water for swimming or plants that provide oxygen.
The student can illustrate and label how different parts of the habitat, like water and plants, work together to meet the needs of the fish.
